reasoning: Acute bacterial infection of upper female reproductive tract with incidence ~2.1 per 100k population globally (1-2 per 100 women of reproductive age annually). Reporting incidence as appropriate for acute infectious disease. Geographic variation reflects regional STI prevalence differences.
source: CDC STI Surveillance 2005; Wiesenfeld HC et al. (2012). Pelvic inflammatory disease: clinical manifestations and diagnosis. Obstet Gynecol. 119(6):1243-1251
